verses.roman:
punaś ca satram āvrajya
munīnāṁ brahma-vādinām
svānubhūtam aśeṣeṇa
rājan bhṛgur avarṇayat

synonyms: punaḥ—again; ca—and; satram—to the sacrifice; āvrajya—going; munīnām—of the sages; brahma-vādinām—who were expert in knowledge of the Vedas; sva—by himself; anubhūtam—experienced; aśeṣeṇa—in full; rājan—O King (Parīkṣit); bhṛguḥ—Bhṛgu; avarṇayat—described.
translation: O King, Bhṛgu then returned to the sacrificial arena of the wise Vedic authorities and described his entire experience to them.
